qas.question: What type of groups do monocots form, based on a recent APG studies?
Eudicots or tricolpates are part of a monophyletic group formed by what species?
What third major clade can many dicot species be found in?
How many species dicot species are magnoliids?
Basal angiosperms are what type of grouping of primitive species?
How many species of Chloranthaceae are eudicots?

plausible_answers.text: monocots form a monophyletic group (clade) but that the dicots do not (they are paraphyletic).

qas.question: What do studies by the monophyletic group show?

plausible_answers.text: a monophyletic group, called the eudicots or tricolpates

qas.question: What do a majority of monocot Ceratophyllaceae species form?
What do the remaining monocot species belong to?
What is the group known as that remainig monocot species belong to?

context: Recent studies, as by the APG, show that the <b6_0>monocots form a <a0_0>monophyletic<a0_0/> group (clade) but that the dicots do not (they are paraphyletic).<b6_0/> Nevertheless, the majority of <a1_0>dicot<a1_0/> species do form <b7_0>a monophyletic group, called the eudicots or tricolpates<b7_0/>. Of the remaining dicot species, most belong to <b8_0>a third major clade<b8_0/> known as <b9_0>the <a2_0>magnoliids<b9_0/><a2_0/>, containing <a3_0><b5_0>about 9,000<b5_0/><a3_0/> species. The rest include a <a4_0>paraphyletic<a4_0/> grouping of primitive species known collectively as the basal angiosperms, plus the families Ceratophyllaceae and Chloranthaceae.
